body:
> As I see it Go is very focused on productivity, this would be far more productive than a stack trace full of pointers and the like.

Stack trace is a run time thing. Up to now I believed we're talking about compile time messages.

> This feature alone almost made me want to switch to rust!

Perhaps use some better editor/better editor setup which can quickly point the cursor to the error location based on the compiler output. Then the value of the enhanced error message per se becomes negligible, IMO.
